venue.name: Ministry Of Education, Science and Technology HQ, Makurdi

events.description: We will Attempt to form a team of volunteers that will help kick start GDG Makurdi

events.name: IWD Makurdi 2018

venue.name: Ministry Of Education, Science and Technology HQ, Makurdi

events.description: We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

events.name: GDG Makurdi Initialize / Google I/O Extended 2018 Makurdi

venue.name: Directorate of ICT - Benue State University (BSU)

events.description:
We will get together to discuss and get to know members of our community better, we will be inviting awesome speakers from neighboring developer community too.

Join us as we start a new journey in our developer community. Everyone is invited! Together is better!!

About Google I/O Extended 2018: Join us for Google I/O Extended 2018 Makurdi Edition as we focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions, in real-time. We will also offer other unique activities targeted to developers such as hackathons and codelabs over coffe, drinks and snacks.

events.name: Google Cloud Next '18 Extended - Makurdi

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '18 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into cloud with technical keynotes, a hands-on TOPIC (Kubernetes, ML, or Google Cloud Certification) lab, and local speakers.

As an attendee, you'll not only be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best Next Extended yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://cloudnext.withgoogle.com/ to learn more about Google Cloud Next '18.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Agenda:
11:00am: Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
11:10am: Udacity Course Lesson 1
01:30pm: Break
2:00pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1 continue
4:00pm: Event ends

events.name: WTM Makurdi

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs. It will also bring out the passion and interest in technology in the life of females.

All females from whichever ethnicity are welcome, it is an open meeting for ladies/women.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Agenda:

events.name: Organisers meetup

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description: This event is for Organisers of GDG Makurdi ONLY. We intend to meet and discus how to deliver more value to everyone in the community.

events.name: Monthly Community Hangout (Maiden Edition)

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Introducing the first edition of our monthly community hangout.
In this edition we will be doing the following:

1. Hands-on intro to androidthings (IoT)
2. Plan things for our regional DevFest and the DevFest season
3. Get to know each other better.
4. Answer questions and help members with issues. etc.
events.how_to_find_us: Take a bus or motocycle taxi and ask them to drop you at Symbols, Opposite BSU second gate.

events.name: WTM hackathon

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description: Come along with your idea cap and bring your laptop along and if you don't have, you are still welcome

events.name: North-Central DevFest 2018 Abuja
events.description:
We will be co-hosting the regional DevFest for North-Central Nigeria alongside other GDGs from the region. The event will happen at Abuja.

DevFest are large community run developer event featuring talks, codelabs, hackathons etc.

events.name: DevFest 2018 Makurdi
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

EXAMPLE AGENDA:
10:00 AM Registration & Welcome Coffee
10:30 AM Introduction to Android
10:50 AM Talk: Digital well being
11:40 AM What's new on Firebase
12:30 PM Lunch time / Networking
2:00 PM Talk: Android
2:50 PM Talk: Google Cloud Vision
3:40 PM Talk: Kotlin
4:20 PM Introduction to Machine Learning
4:20 PM Hands on session: WORKSHOP
4:50 PM Closing & Happy Hour
events.how_to_find_us: Once in the city of Makurdi, Take a bus or commercial bike (okada) and tell them you are going to Lois Hotels at Gyado villa.

events.name: Monthly Community Hangout (New Year Edition)

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Happy New Year!!!
We meet usually on the last Saturday of every month to talk about tech trends, exchange knowledge/experience/tools, help newbies and exchange snacks and other goodies (if available).

For this month will be having (not limited to)

1. A mini hackathon (45 mins of collaboration)
2. Plan things for an awesome 2019 as a community
3. Get to know each other better.
4. Answer questions and help members with issues. etc.
events.how_to_find_us: Take a bus or motocycle taxi and ask them to drop you at Symbols, Opposite BSU second gate.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Makurdi

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

SAMPLE Agenda:
10:00am: 3 Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
12:30pm: Break
12:50pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
1:30pm: Event ends

events.name: IWD [Makurdi] 2019
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2019 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

There are going to be both local and international guest speakers, they are going to guide us on the journey of tech.

events.name: Monthly Community Hangout (April Edition)

venue.name: GISC JAMB Center, Top floor, Symbols

events.description:
Introducing the April edition of our monthly community hangout.
In this edition we will be doing the following:

1. Google Africa Certifications Scholarship: Getting started.
2. It's Google I/O season in May. Extending All the excitement to our community.
3. Network and unblock challenges together.
4. Answer questions and help members with issues. etc.
events.how_to_find_us: Take a bus or motocycle taxi and ask them to drop you at Symbols, Opposite BSU second gate, You will find us on the top floor.

events.name: I/O Extended Makurdi 2019

venue.name: Ministry Of Education, Science and Technology HQ, Makurdi

events.description:
Welcome to I/O Extended 2019! Join us for some livestream content of the Google I/O conference as well as some live talks and hands-on labs!

Temp Agenda:
10:00am: Check-in and breakfast
10:15am: Welcome/Intro and about I/O extended
11:10am: Google I/O keynote viewing starts
01:00pm - 2:00pm: Speaker sessions
01:30pm: Lunch
2:00pm-3:00pm: Hands-on sessions
events.how_to_find_us: Ministry of Education Science and Technology HQ is opposite Benue Hotels LTD. Call 08060386628 if you need further assistance.

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Makurdi

venue.name: Ministry Of Education, Science and Technology HQ, Makurdi

events.description:
Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.
Together we'll work through several Android / Google Cloud / multi-platform labs. You will get hands-on experience with Kotlin in Android, multi-platform with Kotlin/Native, Google Cloud Platform and Kotlin/JS.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook). The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed. Don’t forget your charger!

organizers.name: Pius A.
organizers.bio: Mobile and Web Application developer, Retired gamer, With some sense of humor ;p

group_profile.intro:
I am a web/mobile developer from Benue state Nigeria. 

Certified computer scientist, I am very passionate about building the tech eco-system in Benue. I love building stuffs and hanging with others like me.
